text: Persea lingue is a species of plant in the family Lauraceae. It belongs to the genus Persea, which contains about 150 species of evergreen trees. It is found in Argentina and Chile. It is threatened by habitat loss. ==Distribution== Native in Argentina and Chile. ==Use== In pharmacy its bark was once mentioned as cortex Lauri lingue, medicinal action unknown. ==Etymology== Persea see Persea. Lingue from Lingue River in Chile, where it grows. ==References== lingue Category:Flora of central Chile Category:Near threatened plants Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Persea lingue
